poem:
Title: "An Unholy Communion"

Good Friday finds the faithful on the M1,
Easter escapees amidst tumult and tedium.
In the heart of the holdups, a hallowed communion,
Bound by the bonnet, baptized by rain.
Silver veins of rail cut through the chaos,
Yet trains too trip on the ties of the track.
So we learn – salvation isn't found in escapes,
But in the stillness of staying.
